mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reports that the Herald brings news that [the barn burners?] have been been defeated.; he hears that the Tammany Hall was a "Tyler affair," but he did not receive an invitation; would like him to make an inquiry about it; asks again if Beeman has been removed; believes that all the men connected with him are in Washington. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, no year January 10, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Alexander Gardiner, New York City, N.Y.
